result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan J Rehdantz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Cases called: 16CF438, 16CF298, 16CF505 & 15CM666, Defendant, Jonathan J Rehdantz, appeared with Attorney Amanda Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts one in 16CF298, 16CF438 and 15CM666. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. In 16CF298, 2 years probation, 45 days jail commencing  January 29, 2018 at 7 p.m. Huber for work and treatment. $518 costs. Maintain absolute sobriety. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. (9 days jail credit) In 16CF438, $705 fine. Sixty days to pay or payment plan with Clerk of Court. Knife to be destroyed by law enforcement. Submit DNA sample. In 15CM666, 1 year probation, $443 costs. Maintain absolute sobriety.  Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. (5 days jail credit)  16CF505 read in and dismissed, as well as remaining counts in all cases.  All posted cash bond applied first to fine in 16CF438. 11:09 a.m. - 11:45 a.m.
